examples: The only reason he did not rise in the Church, we are told, was the envy of others, and a disrelish entertained of him

entries.meaning: Absence of relishing or palatable quality; bad taste; nauseousness.

verbs.description: disrelish (third-person singular simple present disrelishes, present participle disrelishing, simple past and past participle disrelished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To have no taste for; to reject as distasteful.
examples: Everybody is so concerned for the public, that all private enjoyments are lost or disrelished

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deprive of relish; to make nauseous or disgusting in a slight degree.
